column4: what's the parameter to have a terminal program run in the background, like wvdial?
do I upgrade my stuff with Synaptic?
smart upgrade upgrades everything you have and the packages you need with that upgrade, nothing more, nothing less
check the version, it's something complicated here: 0.99+1.0PR+revertedto0.9.3
I guess it means that you have 09.3 with quite some features from .99 and 1
tried /dev/sda5 instead of /dev/sda2 if it's an extended partition it could very well be /sda5
remove the high resolutions from the XF86Config-4 file
being a former RISC OS user I can appreciate ROX-filer, but nautilus works just fine for me now
I'm in a GNOME-free environment at the moment
you still can run nautilus there ;) but i get your point, mc is nice as well ;)
